member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.CustomMarkups.ContentControlProperties.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the category of document parts that will be used as the filter when determining the possible choices of document parts that are displayed for insertion into the Content Control item. A document part category is a sub-classification within a given document part Gallery which can be used to further categorize the parts in a given Gallery. This property is applicable when the parent Content Control type is BuildingBlockGallery or DocPartObj.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether a Content Control item is checked. This property is applicable when the parent Content Control type is CheckBox.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfEncryptionDetails.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Specifies the owner password for the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The owner password allows the user to open an encrypted PDF document without any access restrictions specified in .
The owner password cannot be the same as the user password. If you don't specify an owner password, then the system will generate a random password when generating the PDF document.

code.source: ..\Packages\Document .Net\Code samples\CSharp\01. Document\07. Document Properties\05. Secure a Document by password\Sample.cs
code.title: Create and secure a PDF document by password. Also set the permissions for the document using C#

code.title: Create and secure a PDF document by password. Also set the permissions for the document using VB.Net

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfEncryptionDetails.UserPassword
member.summary: Specifies the user password required for opening the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The user password will be required to open an encrypted PDF document for viewing. The permissions specified in will be enforced by the reader software.
The user password can be null or empty string, in this case no password will be required from the user when opening the PDF document. The user password cannot be the same as the owner password.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.ShapeBase.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones this element instance.

remarks.para: This method serves as a copy constructor for elements. The cloned element has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original element.

If you want to insert this element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with Import<T>(T,System.Boolean,System.Boolean) method and then insert the imported element.

member.returns: The cloned element.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrapSide
member.summary: Specifies what side(s) of the shape or picture the text wraps around.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrapSide.Both
member.summary: The document text wraps on both sides of the shape.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrapSide.Left
member.summary: The document text wraps on the left side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the right of the shape.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrapSide.Right
member.summary: The document text wraps on the right side of the shape only. There is a text free area on the left side of the shape.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrapSide.Largest
member.summary: The document text wraps on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin, leaving text free area on the other side of the shape.

member.summary: Specifies how text is wrapped around a shape or picture.

member.summary: Wraps text around all sides of the square bounding box of the shape.

member.summary: Wraps tightly around the edges of the shape, instead of wrapping around the bounding box.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrappingStyle.Through
member.summary: Same as Tight, but wraps inside any parts of the shape that are open.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrappingStyle.TopAndBottom
member.summary: The text stops at the top of the shape and restarts on the line below the shape.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrappingStyle.BehindText
member.summary: No text wrapping around the shape. The shape is placed behind of text.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Drawing.WrappingStyle.InFrontOfText
member.summary: No text wrapping around the shape. The shape is placed in front of text.

member.summary: Clones this element instance.

remarks.para: This method serves as a copy constructor for elements. The cloned element has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original element.

If you want to insert this element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with Import<T>(T,System.Boolean,System.Boolean) method and then insert the imported element.

member.returns: The cloned element.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.ProduceOnlyHtmlBody
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to produce a complete HTML document or only between between <body>...</body> tags. Default value: false.
member.remarks:
In case of 'True' you will get only HTML between <body>...</body> tags.
This property will be useful to merge multiply HTML documents into a single.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.UseNumericCharacterReference
member.summary: In case of 'true': Write the all characters in "NCR" notation: &#xxx;. In case of 'false': Write the all characters as Unicode (recommended). Default value: false.
member.remarks:
A numeric character reference (NCR) is a common markup construct used in SGML and other SGML-related markup languages such as HTML and XML. It consists of a short sequence of characters that, in turn, represent a single character from the Universal Character Set (UCS) of Unicode.
See details in Wikipedia ...

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets a title for the produced HTML document. Default value: "Untitled document".

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat
member.summary: Specifies the image format to embed in the document during the saving. Default value: .

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Auto
member.summary: Default. In this case the embedded images will keep their original format. The Jpeg images will be stored using Jpeg codec, the all others as PNG.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Jpeg format. Be careful: using Jpeg for images you can reduce the PDF size, but could lose the transparency.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Png
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Png format.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbeddedJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets and sets the value value indicating Jpeg quality level. Affects only to the images which embedded in Jpeg format. Default value: 90.

remarks.p: The amount of JPEG compression should really depend on the usage purpose for the JPEG, and the contents of the JPEG.
The quality level one should choose when exporting an image to JPEG is highly dependent upon the kind of detail contained within the image.

An image of a smooth blue sky or a sunset sky with large areas of orange gradient should probably use a high quality setting, 90-100. An image that contains nothing but complex detail could probably get away with a quality setting of 50-60, possibly even lower.There is no single "best" JPEG compression setting, and depending on the type and complexity of detail(or lack of complexity and detail), you may find yourself using 40-60, 70-80, or 90-100 as appropriate for the photo(s) you are exporting.

Here is a test with quality from left to right: 10, 20, 30, 40, 55, 70, 80, 90, 100%.
File sizes for the full files are: 210k, 278k, 347k, 477k, 601k, 709k, 987k, 1.7M, 7M.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSaveOptions.EmbeddedImagesFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the format to embed images in the saving document. Default value: .
member.remarks: Using this property together with the EmbeddedJpegQuality allows you to reduce to size of the saved document.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.FontSettings
member.summary: Contains font related settings which are used when printing, importing or exporting a document to a file format that requires font information.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.FontSettings.MissingFonts
member.summary: Get fonts which were not found during the loading/saving of the current document. Check this property after launching the method Save().
member.remarks:
Next you may download these fonts from Internet, install into your OS or specify a special folder with these user fonts: .
Thus, you can improve the document loading/saving quality and avoid using of alternative fonts.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.FontSettings.UserFontsDirectory
member.summary: Gets and sets an extra folder to search fonts (*.ttf, *.otf, *.ttc). Default value: null.
member.remarks:
By default the component tries to find fonts in standard font folder (for example, in Windows OS - it may be c:\windows\fonts). It will find the standard font folder from the Environment Variables.
But you may add an extra folder to also search fonts in it. Document .Net will try to find and load all font files with these extensions: *.ttf, *.otf, *.ttc.
Steps to find the missing fonts:
1. Load your document.
2. Save the document as PDF.
3. Check the property .
In case of the component will not find the necessary font, it place the font name in this list. Next the component will try to use a substitute font and finally use the default font (Calibri). Next you may download these fonts from Internet, install into your OS or specify the .

member.summary: Specifies that the value for the measurement of the current table width property in the parent table shall be automatically determined by the table layout algorithm when the table is displayed (this width can be adjusted as appropriate).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Tables.TableWidthUnit.Point
member.summary: Specifies that the value for the measurement of the current table width property in the parent table shall be interpreted in points.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.Tables.TableWidthUnit.Percentage
member.summary: Specifies that the value for the measurement of the current table width property in the parent table shall be interpreted as a percent. These percentages shall be calculated relative to the extents specified by the parent element.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.Tables.TableCellFormat.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred width of the table cell.

remarks.para: The preferred width (along with the table's option) determines how the actual width of the cell is calculated by the table layout algorithm. Table layout can be performed by SautinSoft.Document when it saves the document or by Microsoft Word when it displays the document.
The preferred width can be specified in points or in percent. The preferred width can also be specified as "auto", which means no preferred width is specified.
The default value is .

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.Tables.TableStyleFormat

summary.para: Represents a set of table style conditional formatting properties.

These properties affect the appearance of all rows, cells, paragraphs and runs within the parent table matching the specified condition, but may be overridden by individual row, cell, paragraph and run level formatting.

member.remarks: Table style conditional formats are applied to different regions of the table and allow you to define all formatting properties (formatting for a table, rows, cells, paragraphs and runs).

member.summary: Allows to set compression to change size of the PDF document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbedAllFonts
member.summary: Embed all used fonts inside the PDF document. Default value: false.
member.remarks: This makes the PDF document completely standalone and independent of fonts installed on the computer where the PDF document will be opened.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.UseCoreFonts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether or not to substitute TrueType fonts Arial, Times New Roman, Courier New and Symbol with core PDF Type 1 fonts. Default value: false.
member.remarks: The default value is true. When this value is set to true Arial, Times New Roman, Courier New and Symbol fonts are replaced in PDF document with corresponding core Type 1 font.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat
member.summary: Specifies the image format to embed in the document during the saving. Default value: .

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Auto
member.summary: Default. In this case the embedded images will keep their original format. The Jpeg images will be stored using Jpeg codec, the all others as PNG.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Jpeg format. Be careful: using Jpeg for images you can reduce the PDF size, but could lose the transparency.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Png
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Png format.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbeddedJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets and sets the value value indicating Jpeg quality level. Affects only to the images which embedded in Jpeg format. Default value: 90.

remarks.p: The amount of JPEG compression should really depend on the usage purpose for the JPEG, and the contents of the JPEG.
The quality level one should choose when exporting an image to JPEG is highly dependent upon the kind of detail contained within the image.

An image of a smooth blue sky or a sunset sky with large areas of orange gradient should probably use a high quality setting, 90-100. An image that contains nothing but complex detail could probably get away with a quality setting of 50-60, possibly even lower.There is no single "best" JPEG compression setting, and depending on the type and complexity of detail(or lack of complexity and detail), you may find yourself using 40-60, 70-80, or 90-100 as appropriate for the photo(s) you are exporting.

Here is a test with quality from left to right: 10, 20, 30, 40, 55, 70, 80, 90, 100%.
File sizes for the full files are: 210k, 278k, 347k, 477k, 601k, 709k, 987k, 1.7M, 7M.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.EmbeddedImagesFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the format to embed images in the saving document. Default value: .
member.remarks: Using this property together with the EmbeddedJpegQuality allows you to reduce to size of the saved document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfSaveOptions.PreserveFormFields
member.summary: Specifies whether to preserve Microsoft Word form fields as native PDF's form fields or convert them to text. Default is true.
member.remarks: Following fields are supported: , and . When set to false, these fields will be exported as text to PDF. When set to true, these fields will be exported as PDF form fields.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to recreate tables or leave them as graphical lines. Default value: false.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfLoadOptions.OptimizeImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to merge adjacent images into a one. Default value: true.
member.remarks:
This property allows to reduce the total size and the number of images in the document.
We recommend you to set it to true when to reduce th document size and ready to loose a little bit in the quality of images.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfLoadOptions.RasterizeVectorGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to rasterize complex vector graphics or leave them as is. Default value: false.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfLoadOptions.PreserveImages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load images from PDF or skip them. Default value: true.
member.remarks:
Default value: true.
In case of 'false' you may significantly save a time of loading a PDF document and using of memory.
we recommend to set this property to 'false' when you are need only in textual data from PDF.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.PdfLoadOptions.PreserveGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to load vector graphics from PDF or skip it. Default value: true.
member.remarks:
Default value: true.
In case of 'false' you may significantly save a time of loading a PDF document and using of memory.
We recommend to set this property to 'false' when you are need only in textual data from PDF.
Note: that in case of 'false' the properties and will not work.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource
member.summary: Implement this interface to allow mail merge from a custom data source.
member.remarks:
When a data source is created, it should be initialized to point to BOF (before the first record). The mail merge engine will invoke to advance to next record and then invoke
for every merge field it encounters in the document or the current mail merge region.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.MailMerging.IMailMergeDataSource.GetChildDataSource(System.String)
member.summary: The mail merge engine invokes this method when it encounters a beginning of a nested mail merge region.
member.param: The name of the mail merge region. Case-insensitive.
member.returns: A data source object that will provide access to the data records.

remarks.para:
When the mail merge engine populates a mail merge region with data and encounters the beginning of a nested mail merge region in the form of "MERGEFIELD RangeStart:TableName", it invokes
on the current data source object. Your implementation needs to return a new data source object that will provide access to the child records of the current parent record.

Below are the rules that the implementation of
must follow.

If the table that is represented by this data source object has a related child (detail) table with the specified name, then your implementation needs to return a new object that will provide access to the child records of the current record. An example of this is Orders / OrderDetails relationship. Let's assume that the current object represents the Orders table and it has a current order record. Next, mail merge engine encounters "MERGEFIELD RangeStart:OrderDetails" in the document and invokes . You need to create and return a object that will allow to access the OrderDetails record for the current order.
If a data source with the specified sourceName does not exist, your implementation should return .

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding for the RTF file.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.CalculateListItems
member.summary: When true, list items contained in the document will be recalculates before saving. Default: true.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat
member.summary: Specifies the image format to embed in the document during the saving. Default value: .

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Auto
member.summary: Default. In this case the embedded images will keep their original format. The Jpeg images will be stored using Jpeg codec, the all others as PNG.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Jpeg format. Be careful: using Jpeg for images you can reduce the PDF size, but could lose the transparency.
member.remarks: Together with this option you can also control jpeg quality, using the property EmbeddedJpegQuality.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbImagesFormat.Png
member.summary: Force to convert all images into Png format.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbeddedJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets and sets the value value indicating Jpeg quality level. Affects only to the images which embedded in Jpeg format. Default value: 90.

remarks.p: The amount of JPEG compression should really depend on the usage purpose for the JPEG, and the contents of the JPEG.
The quality level one should choose when exporting an image to JPEG is highly dependent upon the kind of detail contained within the image.

An image of a smooth blue sky or a sunset sky with large areas of orange gradient should probably use a high quality setting, 90-100. An image that contains nothing but complex detail could probably get away with a quality setting of 50-60, possibly even lower.There is no single "best" JPEG compression setting, and depending on the type and complexity of detail(or lack of complexity and detail), you may find yourself using 40-60, 70-80, or 90-100 as appropriate for the photo(s) you are exporting.

Here is a test with quality from left to right: 10, 20, 30, 40, 55, 70, 80, 90, 100%.
File sizes for the full files are: 210k, 278k, 347k, 477k, 601k, 709k, 987k, 1.7M, 7M.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.RtfSaveOptions.EmbeddedImagesFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the format to embed images in the saving document. Default value: .
member.remarks: Using this property together with the EmbeddedJpegQuality allows you to reduce to size of the saved document.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings
member.summary: Represents stored preferences which shall be used when processing the contents of the document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.ZoomPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage (between 10 and 500) at which you want to view your document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.ZoomType
member.summary: Gets or sets a zoom value based on the size of the window.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.DefaultTabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which shall be used as the multiplier to generate automatic tab stops in this document.
member.remarks: Default value is 36 points (half an inch).

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.HasFacingPages
member.summary: When true, the document has different headers and footers for odd-numbered and even-numbered pages.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.UseIndentAsNumberingTabStop
member.summary: When true, use hanging indent (if any) as tab stop for bullets and numbering.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.DocumentSettings.CharacterSpacingControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the possible ways in which full-width characters can be compressed to remove additional whitespace when the contents of this document are displayed.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.TableOfEntries.Update
member.summary: Performs an update on (Table of Contents) field.

remarks.para: The field collects entries for a table of contents using heading levels, specified styles, or entries specified by (Table of Contents Entry) fields.
If is not specified method will set a default set of switches: \o "1-3" \h \u \z.

\o "Headings"
Builds a table of contents from paragraphs formatted with built-in heading styles. For example, { TOC \o "1-3" } lists only headings formatted with the styles Heading 1 through Heading 3. If no heading range is specified, all heading levels used in the document are listed. Enclose the range numbers in quotation marks.

\u
Builds a table of contents from paragraphs formatted with all built-in heading styles (1-9).

\f EntryIdentifier
Builds a table from TC fields. If EntryIdentifier is specified, the table is built only from TC fields with the same identifier (typically a letter). For example, { TOC \f t } builds a table of contents from TC fields such as { TC "Entry Text" \f t }.

\h
Inserts TOC entries as hyperlinks.

\n Levels
Omits page numbers from the table of contents. Page numbers are omitted from all levels unless a range of entry levels is specified. For example, { TOC \n 3-4 } omits page numbers from levels 3 and 4. Delete this switch to include page numbers.

\l Levels
Builds a table of contents from TC fields that assign entries to one of the specified levels. For example, { TOC \l 1-4 } builds a table of contents from TC fields that assign entries to levels 1-4. TC fields that assign entries to lower levels are skipped.

\p "Separators"
Specifies the characters that separate an entry and its page number. For example, the field { TOC \p "" }, with an em dash, displays a result such as "Selecting Text53." The default is a tab with leader dots. You can use up to five characters, which must be enclosed in quotation marks.

"Text"
Text to appear in the table of contents for an entry.

\f Type
The type of items collected in a particular contents list. Use a unique Type identifier (typically a letter from A-Z) for each type of list. For example, to build a list of illustrations, mark each illustration with a field such as { TC "Illustration 1" \f i }, where "i" indicates only illustration entries. If no type is specified, the entry is listed in a table of contents.

\l Level
The level of the TC entry. For example, the field { TC "Entering Data" \l 4 } marks a level-4 entry, and Microsoft Word applies the built-in style TOC 4 to that entry in the table of contents. If no level is specified, level 1 is assumed.

\n
Omits the page number for the entry.

For more information about TOC and TC fields, see
Field codes in Word

member.summary: Clones this element instance.

remarks.para: This method serves as a copy constructor for elements. The cloned element has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original element.

If you want to insert this element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with Import<T>(T,System.Boolean,System.Boolean) method and then insert the imported element.

member.returns: The cloned element.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.Level
member.summary: Gets the list level number (0 to 8).

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.CharacterFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets character formatting used for the list label.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets paragraph formatting used for the list level.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification of the actual number of the list item.
member.remarks: The list label is justified relative to the property.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.IsLegal
member.summary: When true, the level turns all inherited numbers to Arabic, false if it preserves their number style.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.NumberFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the number format for the list level.

remarks.para: All text in this property's value shall be taken as literal text to be repeated in each instance of this list level, except for any use of the percent symbol (%) followed by a number, which shall be used to indicate the one-based index of the number to be used at this level. Any number of a level higher than this level shall be ignored.

When the % syntax is used, the number shall be incremented for each subsequent paragraph of that level(sequential or not), until the restart level is seen between two subsequent paragraphs of this level.
Default value is .

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.NumberPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position (in points) of the number or bullet for the list level.
member.remarks: corresponds to plus of the paragraph.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.NumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the number style for this list level.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.RestartAfterLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the list level that must appear before the specified list level restarts numbering.
member.remarks: The value of 0 means the numbering will continue.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.StartAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting number for this list level.
member.remarks: Default value is 1.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.TextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position (in points) for the second line of wrapping text for the list level.
member.remarks: corresponds to of the paragraph.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.TrailingCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character inserted after the number for the list level.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.IsOld
member.summary: When true, the level was converted from Word 6.0 or Word 95.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.ListLevelFormat.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Clears the formatting.
member.remarks: This method will clear all directly set formatting values. When retrieving formatting value, they can still come from other sources.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.Section.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones this element instance.

remarks.para: This method serves as a copy constructor for elements. The cloned element has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original element.

If you want to insert this element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with Import<T>(T,System.Boolean,System.Boolean) method and then insert the imported element.

member.returns: The cloned element.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit
member.summary: Represents the measurement unit for measuring length or distance.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Point
member.summary: Point (1 inch is equal as 72 points).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Pixel
member.summary: Pixel (1 inch is equal as 96 pixels).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Inch
member.summary: Inch (1 inch is equal as 72 points).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Millimeter
member.summary: Millimeter (10 millimeters are equal as 1centimeter).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Centimeter
member.summary: Centimeter (1 inch is around 2.54 centimeters).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Pica
member.summary: Pica (1 pica is equal as 12 points).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Twip
member.summary: Twip (twentieth of a point, 1 point is equal as 20 twips).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LengthUnit.Emu
member.summary: English Metric Unit (1 point is equal as 12,700 EMUs).

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType
member.summary: Represents type of the underline applied to a text.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.None
member.summary: Specifies no underline.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.Single
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a single line.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.Double
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of two lines.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.Dotted
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a series of dots.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.Dashed
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a dashed line.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.DotDash
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a series of dot - dash.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.DotDotDash
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a series of dot - dot - dash.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.Wave
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a single wavy line.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.DoubleWave
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a pair of wavy lines.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.UnderlineType.UnderlineNonSpaceCharactersOnly
member.summary: Specifies an underline consisting of a single line beneath all non-space characters in the text.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.LineSpacingRule
member.summary: Specifies line spacing values for a paragraph.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LineSpacingRule.AtLeast
member.summary: The line spacing can be greater than or equal to, but never less than, the value specified in the property.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LineSpacingRule.Exactly
member.summary: The line spacing never changes from the value specified in the property, even if a larger font is used within the paragraph.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.LineSpacingRule.Multiple
member.summary: The line spacing is specified in the property as the number of lines.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Specifies the outline level of a paragraph in the document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.BodyText
member.summary: The paragraph is at the level of the main text.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level1
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 1 (topmost level).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level2
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 2.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level3
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 3.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level4
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 4.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level5
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 5.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level6
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 6.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level7
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 7.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level8
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 8.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.OutlineLevel.Level9
member.summary: The paragraph is at the outline level 9.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment/type of a tab stop.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.None
member.summary: Clears any tab stop in this position.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.Left
member.summary: Left-aligns the text after the tab stop.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.Center
member.summary: Centers the text around the tab stop.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.Right
member.summary: Right-aligns the text at the tab stop.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.Decimal
member.summary: Aligns the text at the decimal dot.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.Bar
member.summary: Draws a vertical bar at the tab stop position.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabStopAlignment.List
member.summary: The tab is a delimiter between the number/bullet and text in a list item.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.TabCharacterLeader
member.summary: Specifies the type of the leader line displayed under the tab character.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabCharacterLeader.None
member.summary: Specifies that there shall be no leader character.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabCharacterLeader.Dot
member.summary: Specifies that the leader character shall be a dot.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabCharacterLeader.Hyphen
member.summary: Specifies that the leader character shall be a hyphen.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.TabCharacterLeader.Underscore
member.summary: Specifies that the leader character shall be an underscore.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of an absolutely positioned tab character.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAlignment.Left
member.summary: Specifies that the positional tab should be left aligned.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that the positional tab should be center aligned.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAlignment.Right
member.summary: Specifies that the positional tab should be right aligned.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAnchor
member.summary: Specifies the possible extents which can be used to calculate the absolute positioning of the positional tab character.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAnchor.Indent
member.summary: Specifies that the absolute positioning of the tab shall be relative to the indents.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.AbsolutePositionTabAnchor.Margin
member.summary: Specifies that the absolute positioning of the tab shall be relative to the margins.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies vertical justification of text inside of the parent element.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.VerticalAlignment.Top
member.summary: Text is aligned at the top of the parent element.

member.summary: Specifies that the parent object shall be horizontally anchored to the text margins.

member.summary: Specifies that the parent object shall be horizontally anchored to the text extents.

member.summary: Specifies that the horizontal positioning shall be relative to the position of the anchor within its text.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HorizontalPositionAnchor.LeftMargin
member.summary: Specifies that the horizontal positioning shall be relative to the left margin of the page.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HorizontalPositionAnchor.RightMargin
member.summary: Specifies that the horizontal positioning shall be relative to the right margin of the page.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HorizontalPositionAnchor.InsideMargin
member.summary: Specifies that the horizontal positioning shall be relative to the inside margin of the current page (the left margin on odd pages, right on even pages).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HorizontalPositionAnchor.OutsideMargin
member.summary: Specifies that the horizontal positioning shall be relative to the outside margin of the current page (the right margin on odd pages, left on even pages).

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.PdfConversionMode
member.summary: An enumeration of the PDF document conversion modes.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfConversionMode.Flowing
member.summary: The most useful and common type of document for editing. The resulting document looks as if it was typed by human.
member.remarks: The document's layout created without using text boxes. This is very convenient for editing and a resulting document looks as typed by a human.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfConversionMode.Continuous
member.summary: A golden mean between and modes.
member.remarks: The document's layout created by using text boxes grouped in blocks.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfConversionMode.Exact
member.summary: The most precise and fastest mode. The resulting document looks exact as PDF pixel by pixel.
member.remarks: The document's layout created by using text boxes, this gives a monumental accuracy for PDF conversion. Because all text in PDF documents builded by coordinates and using text boxes allows to build resulting document in the same way.

member.summary: Specifies that no editing restrictions have been applied to the document.

member.summary: Specifies that the edits made to this document shall be tracked as revisions.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.EditingRestrictionType.Comments
member.summary: Specifies that the edits made to this document shall be restricted to the insertion and deletion of comments within the document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.EditingRestrictionType.FillingForms
member.summary: Specifies that the edits made to this document shall be restricted to editing of form fields.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.EditingRestrictionType.NoChanges
member.summary: Specifies that the document is read-only (no edits shall be allowed).

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.CssExportMode
member.summary: Specifies how CSS (Cascading Style Sheet) styles are exported to HTML.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.CssExportMode.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore any styling information when generating a HTML.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.CssExportMode.Inline
member.summary: CSS styles are written inline (as a value of the style attribute on every element).

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.CssExportMode.Embedded
member.summary: CSS styles are written separately from the content in a style sheet embedded in the HTML file.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.CssExportMode.External
member.summary: CSS styles are written separately from the content in a style sheet in an external file. The HTML file links the style sheet.

member.summary: Specifies how list labels are exported to HTML and MHTML.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlListExportMode.Auto
member.summary: Outputs list labels in auto mode. Uses HTML native elements when possible.

member.summary: Outputs all list labels as inline text.

member.summary: Outputs all list labels as HTML native elements.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlHeadersFootersExportMode
member.summary: Specifies how headers and footers are exported to HTML and MHTML.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlHeadersFootersExportMode.None
member.summary: Headers and footers are not exported.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlHeadersFootersExportMode.PerSection
member.summary: Primary headers and footers are exported at the beginning and the end of each section.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlHeadersFootersExportMode.FirstSectionHeaderLastSectionFooter
member.summary: Primary header of the first section is exported at the beginning of the document and primary footer is at the end.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlHeadersFootersExportMode.FirstPageHeaderFooterPerSection
member.summary: First page header and footer are exported at the beginning and the end of each section.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlVersion
member.summary: Indicates the version of HTML is used when saving the document to Html and Mhtml formats.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlVersion.Xhtml
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the XHTML 1.0 Transitional standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlVersion.Html5
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the HTML 5 standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlVersion.Html401
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the HTML 4.01 standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlVersion.Html32
member.summary: Saves the document in compliance with the HTML 3.2 standard.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria
member.summary: Specifies how the document is split into parts when saving to Html format.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria.None
member.summary: The document is not split.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria.PageBreak
member.summary: The document is split into parts at explicit page breaks.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria.ColumnBreak
member.summary: The document is split into parts at column breaks.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria.SectionBreak
member.summary: The document is split into parts at a section break of any type.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.HtmlSplitCriteria.HeadingParagraph
member.summary: The document is split into parts at a paragraph formatted using a heading style Heading 1, Heading 2 etc.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.DisallowAll
member.summary: Disallows all operations on the PDF document. This is the default value.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.AllowAll
member.summary: Allows all operations on the PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.ContentCopy
member.summary: Allows copying or otherwise extracting text and graphics from the document, including extraction for accessibility purposes.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.ContentCopyForAccessibility
member.summary: Allows extract text and graphics in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and accessibility is allowed whenever ContentCopy is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.ModifyContents
member.summary: Allows modifying the documents contents.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.ModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Allows adding or modifying text annotations. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option also allows filling in form fields.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.FillIn
member.summary: Allows filling in forms and signing the document. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and filling in form is allowed whenever ModifyAnnotations is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.DocumentAssembly
member.summary: Allows assembling the document: inserting, rotating, or deleting pages and creating navigation elements such as bookmarks or thumbnail images. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and document assembly is allowed when ModifyContents is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.Printing
member.summary: Allows printing the document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfPermissions.HighResolutionPrinting
member.summary: Allows printing the document to the highest resolution possible. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and high resolution printing is allowed when Printing is set.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.Document.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm to use for encrypting a PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_40
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 40 bits.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.Document.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_128
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 128 bits.

member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing for the paragraph depending of .

remarks.para: When property is set to , the line spacing can be greater than or equal to, but never less than the specified value.
When property is set to , the line spacing never changes from the specified value, even if a larger font is used within the paragraph.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.Document.Element.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones this element instance.

remarks.para: This method serves as a copy constructor for elements. The cloned element has no parent, but belongs to the same document as the original element.

If you want to insert this element into another document, then you should first import it into another document with Import<T>(T,System.Boolean,System.Boolean) method and then insert the imported element.

member.returns: The cloned element.
